docs.snippet: Thanks to Trump the unsayable can now be said. “Go back to where you came from,” is the phrase of the moment.
Facebook’s quarterly revenue is up 50 percent and its monthly users 15 percent, versus Twitter’s 20 percent growth and 3 percent rise in users.

headline.main: Facebook Casts a Giant Shadow Over Twitter

docs.snippet: Facebook is launching a "lite" version of it Messenger chat app. It is aimed at emerging markets, where many people use older phones that don't have enough room to store or ability to run the full-featured application due to slower internet speeds...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Launches 'Lite' Version of Messenger Overseas
headline.main: Facebook Launches 'Lite' Version of Messenger Overseas

docs.snippet: Facebook says some 450 million people use its site — mainly the "Groups" feature — to buy and sell stuff locally, anything from cars to baby clothes to furniture. Now, the company is launching a separate "marketplace" section that seek...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Launches New 'Marketplace' for Buying, Selling
headline.main: Facebook Launches New 'Marketplace' for Buying, Selling

docs.snippet: It’s not that the world’s largest social network wants you to read less trash. It just wants you to feel better about it inside Facebook.

headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Bars Cheesy Headlines That Let Readers Down

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc launched Marketplace to allow people to buy and sell items locally as the social media network tries new ways to keep users engaged.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Launches Marketplace for Local Buying and Selling
headline.main: Facebook Launches Marketplace for Local Buying and Selling

docs.snippet: Facebook is to build its third data center outside the United States in Denmark to store and manage the social media giant's growing data, such as photos and videos, a Danish news website reported.

headline.print_headline: Facebook to Build Data Center in Denmark: Report
headline.main: Facebook to Build Data Center in Denmark: Report

docs.snippet: Critics say the social network needs to do more to stop circumvention of its six-month-old prohibition. Gun enthusiasts want the ban lifted.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Users Get Around a Gun Sales Ban
headline.main: Facebook Banned Gun Sales. So Why Is It Still ‘Full of Them’?

docs.abstract: Growing number of Facebook users have found ways to skirt company's ban on private gun sales on social network.

docs.snippet: Tauseef Ahmad Bhat, 29, was accused of “liking, sharing and posting anti-India content on Facebook,” a police official said.

headline.print_headline: India Accuses Man of Sedition for Using Facebook to Urge Pullout From Kashmir
headline.main: Kashmiri Faces Sedition Charges Over Facebook Activity

docs.abstract: Police in India arrest Kashmiri engineer Tauseef Ahmad Bhat and charge him with sedition based on Facebook content he posted or shared calling for India to withdraw from Himalayan region of Kashmir; arrest was prompted by members of right-wing Hindu activist group who noticed posts.

docs.snippet: Trump refuses to take responsibility for giving a platform to white supremacists.

headline.print_headline: Donald Trump’s Big Idea: Don’t Blame Me
headline.main: Donald Trump’s Big Idea: Don’t Blame Me
